subject: Mandatory completion of Safety works for issuance of Provisional Completion Certificate & Designation of Road Safety officer - reg.
text: HRh 75q rTHRf gifera5rut (Ts;5 4Rde7 & TTHNf 4A1T4, 4RG TAR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) F Tt 6fl-5 Qa 6, 7qz7-10, Ea, 78f @ovft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10_ Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 /Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAII Policy Guidelines/Road Safety/2022 Policy Circular No 12.27/2022 dated 22nd September, 2022 [Decision taken on File No. NHAI_ RSC/2022/ Misc. (Computer No: 163987)] Sub: Mandatory completion of Safety works for issuance of Provisional Completion Certificate & Designation of Road safety officer- reg: Ref: Policy Circular no. 9.2.22/2018 dated 02.08.2018 ji Letter no. NHAIICGM (CMC)/2015/75902 dated 21.12.2015 As per provisions of Contract, Provisional Completion means that the Project Highway can safely and reliably be placed in operation /service of users and minor works which are incomplete and are not likely to cause material inconvenience to the users or affect their safety are included in the punch list to be completed within 30 days. 2_ Accordingly, Provisional Completion Certificate is issued upon inspection of Project Highway by AE/IE under supervision by PD in consultation with RO for EPC/PPP projects in line with the provisions of the Contract/ Concession Agreement and Policy circular /letter cited under reference (i) & (ii). 3_ However, it has come to notice that Provisional Completion Certificates are being issued keeping safety items /works such as road markings, road signages, end treatment of crash barriers etc: in the punch which not only compromise the safety of users but also bring a bad name to NHAI upon occurrence of accidents/fatalities. 4. In this regard, the Authority has taken a serious view towards the dereliction of duty by the representatives of NHAI/IE/AE involved in the process of issuance of the Provisional Completion Certificate, thereby jeopardising the safety of users in utter disregard of the above said Policy Guidelines and provisions of the Contract /Concession Agreement. 5_ It must be ensured that road safety works o the project highway are completed in all respects prior to issuing a Provisional Completion Certificate. RO/PD/IEIAE will be held liable for any fatallserious accident(s) that occur as a result of poor road engineering works and insufficient or poor installation of road safety furniture 6_ In addition to the above, the following points are to be strictly complied with: a  Wherever, Officers who have undergone 15-day Road Safety Auditor certification course are to be designated as Road Safety Officer; b Nomination of Officer(s) shall not be withdrawn under any circumstances from the 15- Road Safety Auditor certification Course. 7 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. 22/62/22 (Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord.)
